Circle of Competence

A wise investor named Warren once said to invest in companies that you know, with businesses you understand. He called this the “Circle of Competence.” If it worked for Mr. Buffett, it can work for you.

Select the companies you know on the page below: the ones that make the technology you use, the goods you wear or the foods you eat and drink. You get the idea. Then slide them into the circle. Have fun!

Circle of Competence

Life Insurance

“It happens all too frequently: many people are improperly sold a Life Insurance policy, particularly young people who don’t need it at their stage in life. Before you purchase life insurance, ask yourself these four questions: we call it: the 4 ‘M’ test.”

Q1. Do you have a? (Mortgage)

Q2. Are you? (Married)

Q3. Are you a?

Q4. Are you a? (Multi-millionaire: $10+ million)

Submit
Your response has been submitted

If you answered “no” to these questions, you likely don’t need to purchase life insurance. If you answered “yes” to #2 and/or #3 , then it’s likely you need a life insurance policy. A term policy may suffice to fulfill the needs described in questions 1, 2 & 3.

But if you answered “yes” to #4, you may need a (much more complicated) Whole Life policy to protect your estate from so-called “death taxes.” In each of these ‘yes’ situations, we recommend more research and perhaps a conversation with your financial advisor.

Annuity

Many people are also improperly sold Annuity policies, which are very complex and come in all shapes and sizes: tax-deferred annuities, variable annuities and so on. We’ll make it simple for you to know if you may be a good fit. We call it: the 4 ‘L’ test.

Q1. Do you have “Longevity” in your family history?

(ie. have your parents and relatives been alive for more than, say, 80 years?)

Q2. Do you have ample Liquidity in your financial situation?

(Because annuities lock up your money, for up to 8 years with steep fees to withdraw funds.)

Q3. Are you “Loaded?”

(Annuities are widely recommended to consist of no more than 25% of your total investable assets so you typically need a lot of wealth in order to be a good candidate for one.)

Q4. Are you currently Roman Numeral “L” years of age or older? Are you 50 years old?

Are you 50 years old?

Submit
Your response has been submitted

If you answered “no” to these questions, you likely don’t need to purchase life insurance. If you answered “yes” to #2 and/or #3 , then it’s likely you need a life insurance policy. A term policy may suffice to fulfill the needs described in questions 1, 2 & 3.

But if you answered “yes” to #4, you may need a (much more complicated) Whole Life policy to protect your estate from so-called “death taxes.” In each of these ‘yes’ situations, we recommend more research and perhaps a conversation with your financial advisor.

About Us

It’s not about us.  It’s about YOU.  We’re not asking you to open an account with us.  We’re not asking for personal information such as your Social Security number.  And we’re definitely not asking for your phone number so that we can call you on a Sunday morning – yes, at least one financial website has done exactly that! (But we are asking for your email so that we can keep in touch with you.) 

This site is for you:  to provide you with financial resources and tools with which you grow your wealth.  By ‘you,’ we are referring to the novice investor, the teenager who has no money yet but wants to learn, the newly married couple who just paid off their student loans and want to get started in the markets, or the newly-retired go-getter who wants to take a “DIY” approach.

Investing has become an over-complicated affair – the Wall Street crowd loves it that way and profits accordingly.  But we aim to distill all the investment noise to its core essentials, yet still provide you with the necessary tools to make a wise decision. How do we know how to do this? 

The founder of this site holds the CFA designation and is also a Certified Financial Planner who has spent over 20 years in finance working for a big Wall Street firm as well as two of the ubiquitous “too big to fail” banks that dominate the American financial landscape. 

As such, a long and growing career of understanding basic principles are laid out in this site; we hope, for your benefit and learning. The co-creator of this site is a machine-learning specialist who personally built out the Monte Carlo models herein that are so pivotal in helping you envision the power of compounded investing. 

We combined our talents with one goal in mind:  to help you build your wealth. We hope this website is as fun for you to work through as it was for us to build it. 

Happy investing everyone! Thank you for visiting our site.
